vague_description: Determine the optimal combination of small and large butcher shops to meet production and labor constraints with minimal shop count.
detailed_description: A hot dog company can build two types of butcher shops, a small shop and a large shop. A small shop can make \param{HotDogsSmall} hot dogs per day and requires \param{WorkersSmall} workers. A large shop can make \param{HotDogsLarge} hot dogs per day and requires \param{WorkersLarge} workers. The company must make at least \param{MinHotDogs} hot dogs per day but they only have available \param{TotalWorkers} workers. How many of each butcher shop should the company build to minimize the total number of butcher shops?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of small and large butcher shops
target_constraints: Number of small shops is non-negative
Number of large shops is non-negative
Total daily hot dogs produced by small and large shops must be at least MinHotDogs
Total workers for small and large shops must not exceed TotalWorkers
target_parameters: Number of hot dogs produced per day by a small shop
Number of workers required for a small shop
Number of hot dogs produced per day by a large shop
Number of workers required for a large shop
Minimum number of hot dogs that must be produced per day
